DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Disease or Disorder Extent Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name for a group of subfields that contain detailed site-specific codes for the anatomic extent of disease (EOD).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Disease or Disorder Extent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The name for a group of subfields that contain detailed site-specific codes for the anatomic extent of disease (EOD).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 09/20/2011 - tc - Changed max length to 12 as per data dictionary; added CDE components as derivation to CDE 2688123 that uses this VD. Changed from non-enumerated to enumerated and added PVs from data dictionary. Updated max length. Added Ref Doc to link to EOD manual. mc 6/22/09

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Extent of Disease 10-Dig Description Values
ReferenceDocuments.description: SEER uses the subfields for tumors diagnosed from 1988 forward. Group names appear only in the data dictionary and in Appendix E. Subfields: EOD--Tumor Size [780], EOD--Extension [790], EOD--Extension Prost Path [800], EOD--Lymph Node Involv [810], Regional Nodes Positive [820], Regional Nodes Examined [830]
